channel.title: Sarcasmic Industries
channel.description: Creatives services made from scratch by real human beings in Chicago, Ill.

item.title: Prints for Sale
item.content:encoded:
Want to take it with you?

Almost every show I come home with a photo that should really be hung up on a wall somewhere (or at least monitor wallpaper or a website cover image). Problem is, my walls are almost full. So, I teamed up with MotoPhoto to allow you to order prints and digital downloads from my site, through their print-on-demand service.

Are you a writer for a newspaper, magazine or blog looking for content to accompany your article? Drop me a note (emailjoshhanson[at]gmail.com) and let's work something out.

St. Vincent

St. Vincent at the Chicago Theater, Dec. 2, 2014. More from this show.

St. Vincent

St. Vincent at the Chicago Theater, Dec. 2, 2014. More from this show.

item.title: Pinball
item.content:encoded:
Is pinball's resurgence due to a renewed interest in pop art? Another expression of Gen Xer's desires to extend play into adulthood? The craft movement backlash to an all-digital lifestyle? Whatever the reason, we're the beneficiaries. Chicago, with its half-dozen or so "barcades" opening up in as many years offers a wide range of options for scratching the ever-present pinball itch. Enjoy some of my photographic wanderings through these composite retro/post-modern landscapes here in the Windy City and beyond. 

All rights reserved.

Â

Is the resurgence in the popularity of pinball due to the craft movement backlash to an all-digital lifestyle? Another expression of Gen Xer's desires to extend play into adulthood? Whatever the reason, we're the beneficiaries. Chicago, with its half-dozen or so "barcades" opening up in as many years offers a wide range of options for scratching the ever-present pinball itch. Enjoy some of my photographic wanderings through these composite retro/post-modern landscapes here in the Windy City and beyond. 

Click on an image to scroll through larger versions in lightbox view.

All rights reserved.

item.title: Our First Cider
item.content:encoded:
I can't believe how long it took us to brew a batch of cider. Like all good Chicagoans, we go to an apple orchard every year, feasting on fresh donuts, picking out the perfect pumpkins, and snacking on apples right off the tree. 

I'm not a huge fan of apple cider; it's generally too sweet for my tastes. But dump two jugs into a carboy, add some dry ale yeast and a dry-hop stick stuffed with Equinox hops, and man. I am down. 

We ended up with such a lovely, champagne-style brew, you'd think we spent a ton of time and effort crafting it. But it was only a month from bottle to throttle, and a minuscule amount of actual work. We're definitely going to do the same thing next year. But we'll probably pick up four or five gallons next time, though. Our two jugs gave us a case of 22-ouncers. If we had more, we'd be bringing this seasonal magic with us to every holiday party over the next month or two.
item.dc:creator: ladyinabox@gmail.com

item.title: Mint Chocolate Darkness
item.content:encoded:
Dark times call for dark beers. In a futile attempt to produce the feeling that occurs when drinking the lovely Mint Truffle Abduction by the local lovelies at Pipeworks Brewing Company, we ordered a Mint Chocolate Chip Stout recipe kit from our friends at Adventures in Home Brewing.

OK, so the kit was on sale. And yeah, we had a gift certificate (thanks Matt!). And it did happen to be that deep black moment between Election Day and the inauguration, between Christmas and New Year's, when the light of day is at its shortest. In sum, let's chalk it up to retail therapy.

But, with its Nottingham Ale Dry yeast and an ounce or two of dry hopping (it was one of the Cs, but honestly, it was a heavy moment, OK?), it turned out pretty smooth and subtle.
item.dc:creator: ladyinabox@gmail.com

item.title: Mission-to-Metrics Redesign
item.content:encoded: Copy of Mission-to-Metrics Redesign by Meg White

item.title: Services
item.content:encoded:
Meg White offers a variety of writing, editing, marketing and branding services. As a collaborative partner, she offers a flexible billing structure that allows clients to pay by the project or by the hour, depending on their needs. Each service below includes two rounds of revision (if needed).

Writing

Megâs writing strengths and work experience focus on real estate, technology and B2B communications, but sheâs also proven adept at product descriptions, landing page copy, bios, social media campaigns and even recipes. She creates brilliant copy from scratch, but can also transform your visionâwhether sketched on the back of a napkin or just a burning need to communicate an ideaâinto sparkling copy tailored to your target audience.

Editing

Similar to her writing work, Megâs editing prowess truly shines when communicating with audiences she knows and loves (real estate agents and brokers, tech professionals and other B2B audiences). But she also has a long history as a beta reader and editor for fiction writers, as well as the main editorial consultant on website redesign projects. She loves any opportunity to apply her strategic mind and editing skills to solve daunting communication problems.

Branding, Marketing & Style Guides

Whether youâre just starting out or looking to scale, clarity around your vision, mission, style and audience is crucial. Having thought through these big questions in-house, via agency work and as a freelancer for a variety of brands, Megâs consultative processâwhich focuses on your particular communications goalsâwill meet you wherever you are in your journey.

item.title: Clips & Work History
item.content:encoded:
Below youâll find a small sampling of Meg Whiteâs past work. Please get in touch if youâre looking for something more specific.

Technology

  • Going beyond Bitcoin to forecast the potential of blockchain tech

  • Forecasting how connected devices will impact the real estate industry

  • âWhereâs my hoverboard?â and other important questions about the future of tech

Editorial Strategy

  • Successfully revamping a mission-to-metrics platform for three different editorial audiences

  • Engaging landing page copy for an innovative tech company in the consumer insights industry

Community Building Profiles

  • An ongoing print, online and video project highlighting the community expertise of real estate pros

  • How can the real estate industry nurture the future of the profession in uncertain times?

Home & Design

  • Examining the draw and challenges of the backyard farm trend

  • Turning architectural passions into a successful niche

Development & Planning

  • A candid live event reveals the fractious relationship between developers and city officials

  • Ever want to become a small-scale community developer? Itâs not as hard as you think.

  • The struggles and payoffs involved in implementing net zero in commercial real estate

Branding, Marketing & Sales

  • The highs and lows of marketing and selling historic homes

  • Examining Coldwell Bankerâs historic rebrand

item.title: Feedback
item.content:encoded:
Curious what itâs like to work with Meg? Here are some reactions from other real, live people whoâve worked with her in the past.

âMeg is patient, thoughtful, and open to feedback. â¦ She also asks a lot of questions to help me nail down changes Iâm going to try to implement. â¦ In short, Iâm massively grateful for her! Sheâs brilliant, and Iâd be lost without her guidance and support.â

âYour edits impress me so much because they are small tweaks that pack a big punch. Even your emails blow me away. â¦ I am also grateful for your delivery. When you say you are going to do something, you actually do it.â

âIâve noticed other editors look to you for confirmation about the nuts and bolts of editing â you notice small details and inconsistencies that they don't even consider. â¦ You excel at leading with solutions. You always bring an idea for every hole you poke, and you take it a step further than that. You bring the idea for the solution as well as ways to implement it.â
